description.narrative: General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2017Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: - With respect to women's fight for justice, a historical trial set a precedent in 2016. The project contributed to the development of the oral and public debate on the Case Sepur Zarco, resulting in the indictment of the accused for "crimes against humanity in the form of sexual violence, murder, violation of personal dignity, especially humiliation, degradation and enforced disappearance". This was the first time that that international transcendence crimes are tried in a national court. - The group of women (14) from Sepur Zarco were supported by psychological and legal services, before, during and after the trial on sexual abuse suffered during the armed conflict. The sentence was given on February 26, 2016 against two accused. - As a result of the sentence, reparations measures were included as part of the State responsibility. Even though the sentence was appealed by the accused and their lawyers, the group of women and the Alianza Rompiendo El Silencio has been following up on the implementation of these measures. At the same time, during 2017 the partner has been ensuring the legal strategy so that the sentence remains firm . - Before and during the trial, the political support from the international community was very important. This dialogue and facilitation was facilitated by the Embassy of Sweden. - A Gender Policy titled “ Política para la Equidad de Género e Igualdad con Pertinencia Cultural entre Hombres y Mujeres en la Policía Nacional Civil 2017-20127” was improved, presented and it is in the implementation process within the National Police. - A group of 155 women from 5 Municipalities from Sololá, Alta Verapaz, and Baja Verapaz were trained on Women's rights and prevention of violence. - 14 municipal plans for violence against Women Prevention elaborated by community women leaders participating in the formation process, in coordination with the Municipal Office for Women. - A National Action Plan for the implementation of Resolution 1325 was approved by MIMPAZ (Mesa Inter-institucional sobre Mujer, Paz y Seguridad) in which 14 public institutions were involved. This Action Plan was presented on July 31, 2017 followed by the signing of an interinstitutional agreement to undertake the implementation of said Plan. SEPREM was appointed as responsible for the planning and budgeting actions within each Ministry in order to implement activities included in the Action Plan. However, it is important to note that the Action Plan was not formally approved by the President. Given the current political context it is highly likely that the Plan will not be implemented accordingly, due to lack of political will.
